Chapter 39, Part 4: The Inconceivable Dharma of the TathÄgatas, the Sages
At that time, ÅšÄriputra addressed the Buddha, saying:
World-Honored One!
I now wish to speak a bodhisattva parable.
The Buddha said:
ÅšÄriputra!
Speak according to your intention.
ÅšÄriputra said:
World-Honored One!

It is like the case of good sons and good women who abide in the Great Vehicle, who in dreams practice prajÃ±Ä, dhyÄna, vigor, patience, morality, and giving pÄramitÄs, sit at the site of enlightenment, and realize supreme perfect enlightenment. One should know that these good sons and good women are still close to supreme perfect enlightenment, let alone bodhisattva-mahÄsattvas who, for the sake of supreme perfect enlightenment, practice prajÃ±Ä, dhyÄna, vigor, patience, morality, and giving pÄramitÄs while awake, and do not quickly accomplish supreme perfect enlightenment!
World-Honored One!
This bodhisattva-mahÄsattva will soon sit under the bodhi tree, realize supreme perfect enlightenment, turn the sublime Dharma wheel, and deliver innumerable beings.
World-Honored One!

If good men and good women hear this profound prajÃ±Ä-pÄramitÄ, and accept, hold, read, recite, and practice it as taught, know that these good men and good women have long studied the MahÄyÄna, their wholesome roots are mature, they have made offerings to many Buddhas, served many good friends, and planted many roots of virtue, and are able to accomplish this.
World-Honored One!

If good men and good women hear this profound prajÃ±Ä-pÄramitÄ, believe and understand it, accept and hold it, read and recite it, cultivate it, contemplate it as taught, and expound it to others, these good men and good women have either already received the prediction of great enlightenment or will soon receive the prediction of great enlightenment.
World-Honored One!

These good men and good women are like the bodhisattva-mahÄsattvas who abide in the stage of nonretrogression, who will quickly attain supreme perfect enlightenment. Because they have heard this profound prajÃ±Ä-pÄramitÄ, they are able to deeply believe and understand it, uphold it, recite it, contemplate it according to the principles, practice it according to the teachings, and expound it for others.
World-Honored One!

It is like a person traveling through a vast wilderness, passing through dangerous paths of one hundred yojanas, or two, three, four, or five hundred, who sees the signs of cities and royal capitals, such as herdsmen, gardens, forests, and fields. Having seen these signs, he thinks:
'The cities and royal capitals are not far from here.'
Having had this thought, his body and mind are at ease, and he is not afraid of wild beasts, robbers, hunger, or thirst.
World-Honored One!

It is the same for bodhisattva-mahÄsattvas. If they can hear this profound prajÃ±Ä-pÄramitÄ, accept and uphold it, recite it, contemplate it according to the principles, and deeply give rise to faith and understanding, they should know that before long they will receive a prediction or have already received it, and will quickly realize unsurpassed perfect enlightenment. These bodhisattva-mahÄsattvas have no fear of falling into the stages of Å›rÄvakas or pratyekabuddhas.
Why is it so?
It is because these bodhisattva-mahÄsattvas have already seen, heard, revered, and made offerings to the sign of unsurpassed enlightenment, which is the profound prajÃ±Ä-pÄramitÄ.
At that time, the Buddha told ÅšÄriputra,ğŸ”½It is so!
It is so!
As you have said,
you should speak of it again by the Buddha's power.
Then ÅšÄriputra again addressed the Buddha, saying:
World-Honored One!
It is like a person who wants to see the great ocean. Gradually going towards it, after a long time, not seeing mountains or forests, he thinks like this:
'Now seeing these signs, the great ocean is not far away.
Why is it so?
The land near the seashore must gradually slope down, and there are definitely no mountains or forests.'
Although that person has not yet seen the ocean at that time, seeing the nearby signs, he is overjoyed.
World-Honored One!

The bodhisattva-mahÄsattvas are also like this. If they can hear this profound prajÃ±Ä-pÄramitÄ, accept and uphold it, recite it, contemplate it according to the principles, and deeply give rise to faith and understanding, although this bodhisattva-mahÄsattva has not yet received the Buddha's prediction in person, saying:

'In the future, after so many eons, whether a hundred eons, a thousand eons, a hundred thousand eons, up to whether a hundred thousand koá¹­is of nayutas of eons, you will attain supreme perfect enlightenment.'
But he should know that the prediction is not far away.
Why is it so?

Because this bodhisattva-mahÄsattva has already seen, heard, revered, made offerings to, upheld, recited, and contemplated the supreme marks of profound prajÃ±Ä-pÄramitÄ before attaining unsurpassed enlightenment.
World-Honored One!
It is like in the spring season when the old leaves have fallen from flowering and fruit-bearing trees, and the branches become moist. When people see this, they all say:
'The new flowers, fruits, and leaves will appear before long.
Why is this?
Because the new flowers, fruits, and leaves of these trees have already appeared as signs.
' The men and women, young and old, of JambudvÄ«pa, upon seeing these signs, rejoice and leap with joy, all saying:
'We will soon get to see these flowers, fruits, and lush foliage.
' World-Honored One!

The bodhisattva-mahÄsattvas are also like this. If they can hear this profound prajÃ±Ä-pÄramitÄ, accept and uphold it, recite it, contemplate it according to the principles, and deeply give rise to faith and understanding, it should be known that their wholesome roots from past lives have matured, they have made offerings to many buddhas, served many good friends, and will soon receive the prediction of great enlightenment.
World-Honored One!
This bodhisattva-mahÄsattva should think like this:
'I definitely have the power of superior wholesome roots in the past that can lead to unsurpassed perfect enlightenment.

Now I see and hear the profound prajÃ±Ä-pÄramitÄ, pay homage and make offerings to it, recite it, accept and uphold it, deeply give rise to faith and understanding, contemplate it according to the principles, and cultivate it according to my ability.'
World-Honored One!
In this assembly, there are many celestial sons who have seen past buddhas expound this Dharma. They all give rise to joy and discuss among themselves:

'In the past, the bodhisattvas, upon hearing the teaching of prajÃ±Ä-pÄramitÄ, immediately received the prophecy. Now, the bodhisattvas, having heard this profound prajÃ±Ä-pÄramitÄ, will before long definitely receive the prophecy of enlightenment.'
World-Honored One!

It is like a woman who, as her pregnancy progresses, her body becomes increasingly heavy, her movements are uneasy, her food and sleep are all greatly reduced, she is not fond of speaking much, and is weary of her usual activities, because she is suffering pain.
When another woman sees these signs, she immediately knows that this woman will soon give birth.
World-Honored One!

The bodhisattva-mahÄsattvas are also like this. Having planted good roots in the past, they have made offerings to the buddhas for a long time, served good friends, and their good roots have matured, so now they are able to hear this profound prajÃ±Ä-pÄramitÄ, uphold it, recite it, contemplate it according to the principles, deeply give rise to faith and understanding, and practice it according to their abilities.
World-Honored One!
One should know that this bodhisattva-mahÄsattva, by these causes and conditions, will not receive the prediction of unsurpassed, perfect enlightenment for a long time.
At that time, the Buddha praised ÅšÄriputra, saying:ğŸ”½Excellent!
Excellent!
You are able to speak well of the bodhisattvas' parables for hearing such profound prajÃ±Ä-pÄramitÄ. You should know that all of this is the Buddha's majestic spiritual power.

The bodhisattva-mahÄsattvas seek to attain unsurpassed perfect enlightenment for the sake of benefiting and bringing happiness to many beings, and for the sake of having compassion and benefiting devas and humans.

Second, kind speech.
Third, beneficial action.
Fourth, cooperation.
They also establish them, causing them to diligently cultivate and practice the ten wholesome courses of action.

These bodhisattva-mahÄsattvas themselves practice the four meditations and also teach others to practice the four meditations, they themselves practice the four immeasurable [minds] and also teach others to practice the four immeasurable [minds], they themselves practice the four formless concentrations and also teach others to practice the four formless concentrations, they themselves practice the six perfections and also teach others to practice the six perfections.
